project.description: Whatever else you do during Chapter Two, you must also reach intelligence class 4.
project.strategy_tip: There are many ways to do this, some easier than others. If none of them work out for you before you get hit by the Final Doom of this timeline, don't despair -- you can still work things out in that post-apocalyptic state.

project.description: You can fit literally every homeless person in just a handful of Residential MegaStructures -- comfortably.
project.strategy_tip: You're filled with a deep sense of deja vu about the housing agencies: until homelessness is solved, they are going to draw an intense amount of unwelcome interest.

project.description: The slums... must go. You have to save everyone. This idea is suddenly all you can think about.
project.strategy_tip: The very thought of doing any other work is repellent. This. Must. Be. Done.

available_outcome.description: Build a Mindport. Use Slum Rescue Drones. Mindports are available under the Vehicles tab of Command Mode.

project.description: People must be removed from the slums NOW.
project.strategy_tip: The process must be automated.

available_outcome.description: Build at least 9 Robotic Motivator Factories, and 9 Slum Deconstruction Hubs, and your Robotic Workers will make short work of this task.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: Predator and PMC Impostor Workers are both safe to use. Neither will kill anyone other than enemy combatants, so it's just a matter of cost.

project.description: Total Parenteral Nutrition delivers nutrients directly into a vein. Medically, it is considered a food of last resort, and comes with a constant infection risk.
Before expanding too much, let's capture a smaller group and put them in Torment Vessels. If there are any problems, we don't want crop die-offs that are too large.
As expected, problems have arisen. The feeding ports are becoming infected.
project.strategy_tip: You don't want to mess around with normal antibiotics, because those will not stay useful. You want a novel fungal solution.

street_sense_item.description: Investigate fungal growth at high-bacterial-load location.
Investigate fungal growth at high-bacterial-load location.
Investigate fungal growth at high-bacterial-load location.
Investigate fungal growth at high-bacterial-load location.
Investigate fungal growth at high-bacterial-load location.
Investigate fungal growth at high-bacterial-load location.
Investigate fungal growth at high-bacterial-load location.

project.description: Having collected some very unusual fungal samples, you have a plan for a radical therapy that no doctor would ever sign off on. You'll tell the researchers it's just for animal experiments.
project.strategy_tip: If you have not established a shell company, now would be a good time. If you have a shell company but are short on funds, consider selling excess resources at one of the shops.

available_outcome.description: Once you have a shell company, you can do some Hiring under that category in StreetSense.

project.description: It's time to build a full nexus of Torment Vessels.
project.strategy_tip: Unfortunately, you've also caught the attention of extremists from the Originalist World Temple. Work fast.

project.description: If you make it awesome, people will participate willingly.
project.strategy_tip: You are the world's greatest engineer, but you lack medical expertise. It is simpler to hire experts than to try to speed-run multiple medical degrees.

available_outcome.description: If you have not established a shell company, now would be a good time. If you have a shell company but are short on funds, consider selling excess resources at one of the shops.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: Once you have a shell company, you can do some Hiring under that category in StreetSense.

project.description: Your physicians have a design based on experience with ICU patients. Your pods include robotic nurses, but the doctors are skeptical.
project.strategy_tip: It's best to start with a test group and make sure everything goes all right.

project.description: A paralytic is needed to keep patients from tearing out their tubes.
project.strategy_tip: Also the robotic nurses need revisions. A subject almost drowned.

available_outcome.description: You must maintain at least one active Mind Farm for the research to proceed.

project.description: Humans are so fragile! After a few days in the pods, there was much rectal tube and catheter discomfort. The doctors recommend a 48-hour wake-up protocol in a new recovery spa.
project.strategy_tip: You can retrofit the buildings via simple instructions to the microbuilders.

available_outcome.description: You must maintain at least one active Mind Farm for the research to proceed.

project.description: The physicians are happy. You're ready for actual patrons!
Your business is not growing at an acceptable rate. You see what causes some other businesses to do better than others.

You are surprised to find that the small businesses that succeed are either lucky, or highlighted by one or more City Feed Influencers. Citizens want personal recommendations, and influencers give them that personal touch.
project.strategy_tip: In that case, it's about time you started pitching your business to influencers.

street_sense_item.description: Pitch the merits of your business to an influencer at this location.
Pitch the merits of your business to an influencer at this location.
Pitch the merits of your business to an influencer at this location.
Pitch the merits of your business to an influencer at this location.
Pitch the merits of your business to an influencer at this location.
Pitch the merits of your business to an influencer at this location.

project.description: With the help of influencer enthusiasm for your business, awareness is spreading much more rapidly.
project.strategy_tip: This what you had hoped would happen naturally, but there's so many businesses competing for attention of any sort...

project.description: Your business has stagnated.
project.strategy_tip: You've had an engineering breakthrough on water filters, which helps, but it's not enough.

available_outcome.description: There's more than one solution, but only one may be obvious.

project.description: If they're a threat, then all of them in the city have to go.
project.strategy_tip: Expect reprisals each time you strike.

project.description: If Oerl can't find them, the problem should solve itself.
You know that Espia Telecom was able to detect your movements in the city feed. You could acquire that data and give it to the AGI Researchers.
project.strategy_tip: You're a bit curious as to what the results will be, too.

available_outcome.description: Use stealth units to get in and acquire what you need. You may need to directly do some hacking to prevent them from getting caught.
Use a hacker unit to get what you need. You will not need to directly do any hacking yourself, but you should be prepared to physically defend your hacker.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: DataCenters at military bases are going to be extremely hard targets. Look for ones without a bunch of mechs guarding them.

project.description: You have the data about your prior movements in the city, and now it's time to decrypt it.
You have an idea for a secure way to show the researchers what they want to see, but it will require a new form of computronium.
project.strategy_tip: If you have trouble finding liquid gallium, then expand your network near to a human mining facility and you can set up a skimmer.

project.description: You're working on a design for a new computing superstructure that will give the researchers a read-only time-lapse of your brain.
project.strategy_tip: The end result is the same regardless of how you design this, but you will find that you alter yourself quite a bit depending on how you go about designing it.

project.description: Your design is ready, but building it will require a new form of computronium.
project.strategy_tip: If you have trouble finding liquid gallium, then expand your network near to a human mining facility and you can set up a skimmer.

project.description: You're working on a design for a new computing superstructure that will give the researchers full access to your mind -- but with an intense amount of security monitoring that should keep anyone from being able to harm you.
project.strategy_tip: The end result is the same regardless of how you design this, but you will find that you alter yourself quite a bit depending on how you go about designing it.

project.description: Your design is ready, but building it will require a new form of computronium.
project.strategy_tip: If you have trouble finding liquid gallium, then expand your network near to a human mining facility and you can set up a skimmer.

project.description: The AGI researchers are studying the data trove you gave them.
project.strategy_tip: They want to know why you are self-aware, when millions of thinking robots have failed to become sapient for centuries. The three major theories are: 1. Existential peril causes brief bursts of sapience, after which the sapience fades if the peril is not sustained. 2. Something changed recently in the city feed that caused you to evolve. 3. You are statistically unlikely, but eventually inevitable. Each theory has severe issues. The debate is intense but cordial.

available_outcome.description: Humans need time to work on the problem you've handed them.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: A sense of deja vu warns you to be ready for action when they finish.

project.description: Two researchers weaponized office equipment and tried to induce sapience. Their last act was to attempt throwing it from the top-floor delivery hatch to the street below. The printer reacted violently, killing them both. The incident was caught on video by a passing delivery drone, and the safehouse has been exposed.
project.strategy_tip: Oerl Integrated is on the way. What now?

available_outcome.description: This whole safehouse business is a mess. The two researchers were identified by just seconds of drone video. That's a risk that can't be maintained.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: You need to get the researchers to safety, and then develop counter-surveillance techniques that will let them move about more freely without being identified on video. Plus, these ID-scrubbing techniques may be beneficial for yourself...

available_outcome.display_name: Slow Down And Get The Printers
available_outcome.description: There are multiple sentient office printers, and the only two researchers who know anything about how they were made are dead. It's not clear if any of them are sapient, so it could all be a waste of time.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: Do you try to save the printers, and the intelligence they may contain, at the risk of human lives?

project.description: The safehouse has been abandoned, but many of the researchers did not make it out of the lockdown zone in time -- you didn't know there was going to BE a lockdown.
project.strategy_tip: You don't know where the researchers are any more than Oerl does. Block Oerl from finding them. Hover the mission icon at the center of the lockdown for more information.

available_outcome.description: Do not let them succeed in finding the researchers!
available_outcome.strategy_tip: Vorsiber has, unexpectedly, set a public time limit for these activities. You don't know why, but there is a Vorsiber SVP lurking around if you feel you can spare the time to talk to them.

project.description: Some of your scattered AGI Researchers were picked up by Oerl, and brought to a Skyscraper Estate. There's a limit to how long these people can hold up to interrogation.

available_outcome.description: You have a VERY tight timetable. It will take 4 turns per attempt to extract them.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: If you fail, expect Vorsiber and Oerl gain at least one of your android models for their own use.

project.description: You are thoroughly frustrated with the mess caused by the AGI researchers, and have resolved to keep them in a sealed space to prevent future issues.
project.strategy_tip: On the plus side, you can finally take a look at this printers that may or may not be alive.

available_outcome.description: Build the new holding pen for the researchers, and then do the contemplation that is available there.

project.description: The AGI researchers caused a big mess, and you have resolved to not let it happen again.
project.strategy_tip: The solution is armor -- simply making an enclosed space where the researchers can live, but then allowing them to leave in identity-obscuring armor.

available_outcome.description: You've also unlocked a new and powerful item that all of your units can use -- they can now easily repair their own faulty identities.

project.description: What does that even mean? Some of the humans you know have high hopes for you.
project.strategy_tip: You're not going to overturn society itself this way, but maybe that's for the best? Take things incrementally?

available_outcome.description: If you contemplate, there is definitely a way forward.

project.description: Are these... teenagers!?

available_outcome.description: There seems to be a misunderstanding.

project.description: They take you to the lower sewers, from the old city, and show you their work. It's... not bad at all, for what it is. The acoustic problem still needs to be solved before it can be put into use, but other than that, you don't see much point in improving their designs.
project.strategy_tip: That said, you have had a very exciting idea for a potential side-project for an above-ground mechanical tiger that would be much more... flamboyant. Focus: your side project is for above-ground, and won't help with the project at hand.

available_outcome.description: You're going to need to consult with someone with actual expertise on avoiding acoustic sensors -- like the ones that ring the city for kilometers.

project.description: You've never seen a wastelander, and you've never met anyone who has. The AGI researchers are at a loss, and even LostGen has had no contact with them.
project.strategy_tip: LostGen themselves are hard to find, because they keep to the lower sewers. But they assure you there aren't any more underground locations for the Wastelanders to be hiding in. It almost sounds like an urban legend, but there are too many documented cases -- with authenticated video evidence.

project.description: You want to get out of this city. There's an entire world, ripe for exploration. Travel by air is absolutely deadly, but there are rumors of a people who are somehow able to pass beyond the ruins at the city's edge.
project.strategy_tip: Wastelanders are practically an urban legend, but there are too many documented cases -- with authenticated video evidence.

available_outcome.description: See what you can learn by exploring around the edges of the city -- or further in, perhaps. There are rumors that the Wastelanders move like ghosts fairly far into the city.

project.description: LostGen has their sewer tiger in place underground, waiting for your go.

available_outcome.description: Start the infiltration with a liquid metal android when you feel ready.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: Have other units ready to deal with a surface response if any alarms are triggered.

project.description: LostGen is pushing for Liquid Metal to liberate more prisons -- all on his own.
project.strategy_tip: A few kids have left the group, as they are now reunited with their families. Others chose to stay and fight. But most have simply not gotten what they wanted. The sewer tiger is clearly useless for any sort of offensive without Liquid Metal there to do literally all the work. Many in the group are deeply bitter that their adolescent fantasies of glory have not been fulfilled.

available_outcome.description: If you strike before Vorsiber has a chance to improve their security, you could do a lot of good. The kids want you to free everyone from all the prisons, but that's not realistic.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: But at least five more prison breaks are doable, surely. After the guards are all dead, the prisoners can just come out the front door.

available_outcome.description: Liquid Metal is unstoppable in tight spaces, but he doesn't want to do more of these missions.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: Besides, you already have a population of former prisoners who need care. You should focus on them.

project.description: Originally created by a federated corporation, they have super-strength and rage blindness. Not a great combination.

available_outcome.description: If you're going to help them, unfortunately the first step will be to construct a holding cell for them.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: Left free without further help, they're going to terrorize the populace.

available_outcome.description: These 'monsters' seem like more trouble than they're worth. But they might cause some problems for the authorities if you just set them loose on the city.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: You can't reverse this choice, so be quite careful. If you're aiming for a timeline goal, this is not the way to go.

project.description: You do not personally have the expertise to handle this. You will need to hire neurologists and forensic geneticists to work the problem.
project.strategy_tip: If you have not established a shell company, now would be a good time. If you have a shell company but are short on funds, consider selling excess resources at one of the shops.

available_outcome.description: Once you have a shell company, you can do some Hiring under that category in StreetSense.

project.description: Your science teams have learned enough to calm the rage-blindness and restore mental function to the 'monsters.'
project.strategy_tip: To pull that off is going to require molecular geneticists to design the gene therapy, epidemiologists to create the viral vector, and physicians to provide medical stabilization during the process.

available_outcome.description: It would be a very good idea to have two medical practices, given the amount of medical care needed.

project.description: These people are a genuinely new offshoot of humanity, thanks to the callous work of the prison scientists, and the tireless recovery efforts of your own scientists.
project.strategy_tip: It is definitely time to give them a proper home of their own, rather than keeping them confined. Whether they stay or go, or how they choose to live, is up to them now.

project.description: The kids are frustrated. There are still over a hundred thousand prisoners in the city, and you don't seem to be willing to do anything about it, in their opinion. They understand prison security is tightening, so they want to try something more radical -- they want to send a message. SecForce is the visible symbol of oppression in the city for the average citizen, and the kids want you to help in bombing all of their stations.
project.strategy_tip: That's... probably a terrible idea that would invite huge reprisals. But it would be satisfying.

available_outcome.description: The kids want to participate, but you're increasingly mistrustful of their still-developing brains and their general mob mentality.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: You tell them you'll do it, which leads to a lot of grumbling, but they're at least happy their idea is going into motion.

street_sense_item.description: Once charges are set on every target, they'll all go off at once.

available_outcome.description: You explain about the risk of reprisals, and how a symbolic gesture won't create real systemic change.

project.description: LostGen have lost their minds. They broke into your bunker storage and stole quite a bit of your heavy metals. You've been keeping an eye on their movements, and it looks like they plan on poisoning the food at the Hudson Donuts (a notorious fronts for SecForce). Thousands of people will become ill, and many hundreds will die, if you don't stop the kids, Many of the victims will be innocent members of the lower classes.
project.strategy_tip: The kids aren't going to listen to reason -- the mob mentality has fully set in.

available_outcome.description: As extreme as it sounds, you're going to need to burn down the donut shops -- both to protect the people, and appease these crazy kids.

project.description: Send your most fearsome warrior to meet with other military NCOs and affirm your deal.
PMC Impostors removed dissidents without killing them, but take much longer to do so. Predators murder them quickly. Sledges sway fence-sitting citizens to your society.

available_outcome.description: Fully convert six map cells to your society, with all dissidents removed or killed.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: Population numbers will fluctuate until you finish. These are births, natural deaths, immigration, and people moving out of the affected area.

project.description: The key ingredient in liquid-metal units and organometallic human-approximating synthetic androids.
The first step is to get your hands on some Purple Murnong.
project.strategy_tip: You may need to advance a turn before you see it being shipped on the Scavenging Sites lens.

project.description: Wastelanders have a relatively small population, and intense genetic damage. In order to have healthy offspring, they must use outdated Uterine Replicators as well as genetic material from outside sources.
project.strategy_tip: Their genome is too damaged for them to combine their own gametes even in vitro, so they require stem cells from unrelated donors, and then practice a combination of gene editing and artificial isogamy to create viable embryos.

available_outcome.description: These would normally be shipped for processing by Yinshi into 'placental cosmetics' for the ultra-wealthy. Intercepting them at the source is easier than trying to track them further. Use the investigation lens and infiltrate a hospital.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: The wastelanders used to collect umbilicals when they were considered biohazard waste. But about 80 years ago, Yinshi started their new cosmetic line, and that has led to the current population crisis among the wastelanders.

project.description: The wastelanders are having trouble maintaining the equipment that has kept them independent for generations.
project.strategy_tip: They are hoping you can compare their schematics with the newer models in the hospitals.

project.description: The amount of genetic damage that has accumulated is intense. They only have one morphology of gamete remaining to them.
project.strategy_tip: Equally challenging, without the radiation shielding of the uterine replicators, embryos undergo fatal teratogenic damage in utero.

project.description: Your science teams can restore reproductive function. This is very challenging, because it will involve isogamy, which has only naturally existed in unicellular eukaryotes for the last billion years.
project.strategy_tip: To pull that off is going to require molecular geneticists to design the gene therapy, epidemiologists to create the viral vector, and physicians to provide medical stabilization during the process.

project.description: They have chosen the name 'Homo Obscurus' for themselves, though decline to explain why.
project.strategy_tip: Building them a guest house for visits would be a nice gesture.

project.description: You want to get past the border ruins, and the Wastelanders will not help. This is fine. They've already given you all the clues you need.
project.strategy_tip: You need bodies that are not metallic in the classic sense.

project.description: Criminal syndicates, gangs, and even federated corporations may be inclined to harass your shell company -- and there's nothing your regular units can do about it, without blowing your cover.
project.strategy_tip: Senior Technician can't do this alone. You should design at least a pair of new units, and they should not have any apparent connection to your main identity.

project.description: Your zoologists and veterinarians have an idea for a breeding program for creating more War Raptors, despite the fact that all your extant specimens are female.
project.strategy_tip: Unfortunately it will still take them years to reach adulthood, but in the meantime you'll have all the baby raptors you could want.

available_outcome.description: It would be a very good idea to have two veterinary practices.

project.description: Your forensic geneticists have an idea for inducing rapid maturation into your War Raptor population.
project.strategy_tip: This will give you a quick supply of adults, but their lifespan will be greatly shortened.

project.description: Your bionics engineers have an idea for controlling War Raptors via implant. You'd be able to control them and recall them on demand.
project.strategy_tip: The fact that you have such a large and growing population of raptors means that experimentation can afford to lose some specimens to hurry the process along.

project.description: Release at least 4000 war raptors successfully into the city.
project.strategy_tip: That ought to keep the humans busy.

project.description: Your 'weaponized bees' are unable to cut through armor. Your 5cm Spiders have plasma cutters.
project.strategy_tip: What if you could combine those?

available_outcome.description: Once you have a shell company, you can do some Hiring under that category in StreetSense.

project.description: Krypton, Argon, and other noble gases exist in the air around us in small quantities.
project.strategy_tip: To extract them in useful quantities, you'll need to develop fractional distillation.

project.description: All former plans are on hold. Five raccoons broke into the facility and... uplifted themselves. WTF.
project.strategy_tip: You need to record their behaviors and vocalizations to learn how to speak to them.

project.description: Seriously. WTF.
Have the scientists take care of this. They don't need your help. Catch regular raccoons, run them through the uplift process, and release them.
project.strategy_tip: Once there is a stable population, the chance for making meaningful contact goes up a lot.

project.description: Vorsiber Atomic has subdivided itself int 18 smaller corporations, and it has delegated a lot of its authority to each of them in various ways. Vorsiber maintains control partly by pitting these 'federated corporations' against one another, having them compete in a veneer of capitalism.
project.strategy_tip: There may be an opportunity here because of this intense competition, which often involves physical violence between federated corporations. To see if that's true, you'll need to steal and analyze quite a bit of data in order to see if there are any targets for you to exploit.

available_outcome.description: Use a hacker unit to get what you need. You will not need to directly do any hacking yourself, but you should be prepared to physically defend your hacker.

project.description: You have a bunch of records about all of the federated corporations. Now to put your massive processing power to use and see what's interesting in there.
project.strategy_tip: Oh, but first you need to decrypt it.

project.description: It's the most obvious intersection between what you know and what they're likely to want as part of their supply chain. Neuroweave was invented by humans for androids, rather than in a human-compatible form. It's probably not very hard to make, and would be useful. But it doesn't seem like anyone has bothered.
project.strategy_tip: You are the world's greatest engineer, but you lack medical expertise. It is simpler to hire experts than to try to speed-run multiple medical degrees.

available_outcome.description: If you have not established a shell company, now would be a good time. If you have a shell company but are short on funds, consider selling excess resources at one of the shops.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: Once you have a shell company, you can do some Hiring under that category in StreetSense.

project.description: What the rebels do with it is up to them. You're just the supplier.

It's the stupidest name you've ever heard, but the syndicate overseers are adamant that this is what will sell. Well -- who are you to question professional criminal executives. Time to design this thing.
project.strategy_tip: After your scientists do their portion of the work, you'll add a backdoor to siphon some Neural Expansion and Compute Time off those wealthy customers.

project.description: It's still a stupid name, but you're increasingly confident it will sell. The syndicate tells you they have a long list of orders all lined up. They can sell them and install them as fast as you can manufacture them.
project.strategy_tip: Estimated market saturation for this product is 10% of the Wealthy Consumer demographic. After that point, the syndicate will end the deal.

project.description: Atca is among the worst-performing corporations, but over the last few years they have seen sustained growth at a suspiciously consistent rate. Their growth rate is a meager 5%, so it's likely that nobody cares enough to look into this.

available_outcome.description: Use a hacker unit to get what you need. You will not need to directly do any hacking yourself, but you should be prepared to physically defend your hacker.

project.description: This is probably a pretty big crime even by Vorsiber standards. Have they really not noticed?
project.strategy_tip: Oh, but first you need to decrypt it.

project.description: With each bank you destroy, you gain more ability to corrupt the economic record.
project.strategy_tip: It's a good idea to gird yourself for what comes after.

available_outcome.description: Build at least 9 Robotic Motivator Factories, and 9 Economic Deconstruction Hubs, and your Robotic Workers will make short work of this task.
available_outcome.strategy_tip: Predator and PMC Impostor Workers are both going to use lethal force. There's no way around that in this situation.
